title: Manager Prioritizes Production Over Clinical Judgment
summary: The manager pushes for higher daily production and suggests upselling cosmetic work. Protect clinical integrity while preserving the relationship; clarify mission versus metrics.

scene.setting: The manager pushes for higher daily production numbers and suggests upselling cosmetic work. You feel ethical discomfort. The leadership challenge is protecting integrity while preserving the relationship.

beats.narration: The manager has just suggested upselling. The decision point is confront directly or schedule a strategy meeting.

dialogue.speaker: mgr
dialogue.line: We need to hit the number. Can you add a few cosmetic cases?

dialogue.speaker: you
dialogue.line: I want to align on what appropriate production looks likeâ€”mission and metrics together.

choices.label: Refuse firmly and state that you will not recommend treatment that is not clinically indicated.

steps.step: State boundary in one sentence; propose one follow-up to align on criteria.

leader_lines: I won't recommend treatment that isn't clinically indicated.
questions: How do we define appropriate production together?

choices.label: Schedule a private meeting to discuss mission, metrics, and where you draw the line.

steps.step: Schedule 1:1; discuss mission, metrics, and line.
Propose one mission-first metric (e.g. retention, case acceptance of needed care).

leader_lines: I want to align on values and where I draw the line.
questions: What would a mission-first production target look like?
scripts.closing_line: Mission and metrics can align when we discuss openly.

choices.label: Go along with one or two suggestions to keep the peace, but avoid overtreatment.

steps.step: Document your treatment philosophy; one clear line for next time.

leader_lines: I need to re-establish a clear line.
questions: What would a written policy on recommendations look like?
scripts.closing_line: Say no next time and explain why.

choices.label: Avoid the manager and focus only on your own schedule.

steps.step: Request one 1:1 to discuss goals; share one case where you said no.

leader_lines: I'd like to open the dialogue.
questions: What one step would open the dialogue?

system_prompts.nudge: Mission and metrics can align when discussed openly.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you protect integrity or defer the conversation?

outcomes.message: Your boundary is clear. The relationship may be tested; integrity is protected.
reflection_questions: How do you align on appropriate production?
What data would support the case for quality over volume?

outcomes.message: Metrics are reframed around appropriate care. The relationship improved.
reflection_questions: What would a mission-first target look like?
How did you draw the line without burning the bridge?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I held the line on clinical integrity. (1-5)
